reviewText: This is among the best of religious music.  Appropriate for people of all religions, or even non-believers.  The photography is not the best, but I did not find it such a negative factor as some others.  The cathedral is beautiful.  Please get the CDs, which are better recorded.

reviewText: The Three Priests have a superb blending of voices on this CD of religious music.  Several pieces are sung in Latin which gives added beauty to the singing.  Performed in Ireland, they are joined by the Irish Philharmonic Orchestra, the New Dublin Voices Choir, the St Patrick's Cathedral Choir, and gives special thanks to St Patrick's Catholic Cathedral Armagh.  It is a treasury of beautifully sung music, and is highly recommended to anyone who is a serious music lover.

reviewText: I saw this on IPTV and was captivated by the performance of these three men so I purchased the DVD so I could watch the entire performance.  As a result of watching this, I have purchased two other CDs recorded by The Priests.

reviewText: I can't believe I did not know about this DVD earlier after it was made.  I love sacred music and there are many beautiful, inspiring music for the soul.  I love concertizing beautiful sacred music which lifts and nourishes the soul whether one attends a church or not.  The music speaks for itself, we need more of this type of concerts, the Priests are great, I hope they continue to create more DVDs such as this.  Music is another way communicating with God and the joy of the music certainly uplifts every soul who supports good music.

reviewText: I enjoyed this music a lot. They are great performers and the cathedral was a great setting. Some other artists also performed, all were enjoyable. I bought the dvd used and consider it worth owning.
summary: The Priests: in concert at Armagh Cathedral

reviewText: This DVD of a concert with a rather unusual singing group known collectively as the Priests. All Three sing beautifully, both solo and as a trio. Their harmony is a delight to hear. The selections are all positive, beautiful pieces, and as a plus you even get to see them perform with Sir James and Lady Galway, which is a treat in itself.The whole concert is done in good taste, there is no attempt at oversentimentality or any attempt to hit you over the head with their thoughts or beliefs. Just good clean fun and lots of great singing.Highly recommnended!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This DVD of the three Priests is so worth listening to and purchasing and to share with others. Their voices are heavenly. Their blending is magnificent. I hope they make another. It is spiritually uplifting to watch over and over again. God richly bless you Fathers for you have richly blessed me and the public with your fantastic voices. One thing though, with the first song on the DVD, the orchestra overpowered the Priests voices, but the rest of it their voices come through loud and clear.

I was so happy to see it was available and at a very affordable price.  The performers, the lighting, the Cathedral.....everything about this concert is breathtakingly beautiful!

reviewText: This CD is beautifully sung in many languages and plays to the beautiful memories of Catholics everywhere.  I have seen this production on Public TV and have the CD permanently in my collection of most listened to music.  It is worth far more than its cost.  As soon as The Priests produce another CD, I'll be first in line.
summary: Another Perfect Addition - Rated as a 6 if there was a 6

reviewText: When I first heard about the three Irish Roman Catholic priests who had signed a British recording contract as "The Priests," I was skeptical, as I thought it might be a gimmick featuring singers of merely average tonality. But this DVD contains one of the richest-sounding and most slickly produced sacred choral music concerts I've ever seen. All of the classic Latin hymns from Panis Angelicus to Ave Maria, along with some rollicking secular vernacular songs, are here. But the difference with this program is that it looks and sounds brilliant from start to finish. The three priests have pristine voices, of course, but they are also surrounded here by world-class singers and musicians, and their combined songs with famed headliners like Sir James Galway and Moya Brennan create a very satisfying sound. This 2009 live concert, aired in the United States on PBS, was recorded at St. Patrick Cathedral in Armagh, Northern Ireland. I'm not sure if the concert sounds so good because of the cathedral's acoustics, or because of the recording setup, or because of the Dolby 5.1 sound mix on this disc, or because of a combination of all these factors. I only know that this DVD exceeds all of the similar concert recordings I've seen by Andrea Bocelli, Charlotte Church, and the Three Tenors in terms of its overall sound quality. It is also pretty entertaining, as the three priests display surprising charisma, offering charming introductions and occasional comments during the program. A particular highlight is when they dedicate a song to the 93-year old Catholic sister who taught them music as boys, who is sitting there in the audience, and then one of them greets her after the song. It's a pleasure to see good music performed in such a warm, heartfelt, and inspiring fashion. If you want to see a concert of sacred Christian music classics, this is the disc to get, even if you aren't Irish!
summary: Beautiful sacred music from 3 singing priests with Moya Brennan & Sir James Galway
